unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: MPG and Horsepower
question_text:
A consumer advocate wants to determine the relationship between carsâ€™ miles per gallon (mpg) and horsepower.
A sample of $15\text{ car models}$ from the current year was selected. The regression analysis of the data resulted in the following output:
Coefficients Standard Error t-Stat P-Value
Intercept 36.93884096 2.139220436 17.26743 2.4035E-10
Horsepower -0.051610508 0.009635294 -5.3564 0.00013055
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.
Based on this information, which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: The slope for this line is $36.9388$.
The residual plot shows a pattern; therefore, this appears to be a reasonable model for describing horsepower and mpg.
As horsepower increases by $1\text{ unit}$, the predicted mpg decreases by $5.3564$.
As horsepower increases by $1\text{ unit}$, the predicted mpg decreases by $0.0516$.
The $P$-value indicates no relationship between horsepower and mpg.
